6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: The Descendents
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Provided a blueprint for Blink-182's combination of catchy melodies and punk energy.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Bad Religion
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Influenced Blink-182's lyrical themes and complex song structures.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: The Cure
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Influenced their use of melody and mood, contributing to Blink-182's more emotional and atmospheric tracks.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Screeching Weasel
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Their simple, fast-paced punk rock style had a direct influence on Blink-182's early sound.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: NOFX
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Helped shape Blink-182's sense of humor and approach to punk rock.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Green Day
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Their mainstream success with 'Dookie' was a major influence on Blink-182's aspirations and pop-punk sound.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: The Vandals
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Influenced Blink-182's musical style and their attitude towards live performances.

6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.name: Minor Threat
6FBDaR13swtiWwGhX1WQsP.impact: Inspired Blink-182's DIY ethic and straightforward lyrical approach.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Link Wray
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: Pete Townshend was inspired by the power and rawness of Link Wray's guitar sound.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: John Lee Hooker
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: The rhythmic boogie patterns of Hooker influenced Townshend's guitar playing and songwriting.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Gustav Mahler
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: Townshend has expressed admiration for Mahler's compositions, impacting his approach to creating epic, complex musical works.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Hank Marvin
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: The Shadows' lead guitarist inspired Townshend with his distinctive clean guitar sound and use of the tremolo arm.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Eddie Cochran
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: Cochran's energetic performance style and pioneering use of the electric guitar influenced Townshend's own stage presence and guitar work.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Mose Allison
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: Allison's blend of jazz and blues, along with his lyrical wit, influenced Townshend's songwriting and musical style.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Bob Dylan
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: Dylan's lyrical depth and storytelling prowess had a significant impact on Townshend's approach to songwriting.

24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.name: Chuck Berry
24Wa5wIZIo1sPkzVGP0B5p.impact: Berry's guitar riffs and showmanship were a major influence on Townshend's guitar playing and performance style.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Pink Floyd
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Significantly shaped Wilson's approach to album production and concept album creation.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: King Crimson
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Influenced Wilson's complex compositions and use of unconventional time signatures.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Porcupine Tree
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Wilson's own band, which was a platform for his evolving musical style and experimental soundscapes.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Yes
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Inspired Wilson's intricate arrangements and the expansive scope of his music.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: The Beatles
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Influenced Wilson's songwriting, particularly in terms of melody and harmonic structure.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Tangerine Dream
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Introduced Wilson to the possibilities of synthesizers and electronic textures in music.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Brian Eno
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Influenced Wilson's use of atmosphere and texture in his music.

4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.name: Jethro Tull
4X42BfuhWCAZ2swiVze9O0.impact: Influenced his narrative style and the way he integrates flute into rock music.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: James Brown
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Influenced Michael's vocal style and energetic performance.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: Jackie Wilson
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Influenced Michael's dynamic vocal range and emotive performance.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: Fred Astaire
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Inspired Michael's dance technique and dedication to perfection.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: The Beatles
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Influenced Michael's songwriting and understanding of pop music structure.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: Diana Ross
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Mentored Michael early in his career, influencing his stage presence and professionalism.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: Marvin Gaye
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Influenced Michael's approach to music with deep emotional delivery and social messages.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: Smokey Robinson
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Influenced Michael's songwriting, especially in terms of lyrical content.

3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.name: Stevie Wonder
3fMbdgg4jU18AjLCKBhRSm.impact: Influenced Michael's musical versatility and dedication to innovation.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: David Bowie
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Inspired Madonna's versatility and stage presence.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Debbie Harry
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Influenced Madonna's early punk-pop aesthetic and attitude.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Michael Jackson
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Influenced Madonna's ambition to become a versatile entertainer.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Karen Carpenter
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Influenced Madonna's emotional delivery and vocal style.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Cher
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Inspired by Cher's longevity and ability to reinvent herself.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Donna Summer
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Influenced Madonna's dance music elements and performance style.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Martha Graham
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Martha Graham's discipline and creative approach to movement influenced Madonna's performance style.

6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.name: Stevie Nicks
6tbjWDEIzxoDsBA1FuhfPW.impact: Influenced Madonna's songwriting and stage persona.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Bob Dylan
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Inspired Springsteen's lyricism and storytelling approach.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Elvis Presley
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Springsteen was inspired by Presley's charisma and performance style.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: The Beatles
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Their success and musical innovation motivated Springsteen to pursue a career in music.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Woody Guthrie
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Guthrie's storytelling and social commentary influenced Springsteen's songwriting.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Roy Orbison
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Orbison's emotional singing style and complex song structures had an impact on Springsteen's music.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: The Rolling Stones
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Their gritty style and attitude influenced Springsteen's approach to rock music.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Chuck Berry
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Berry's guitar riffs and performance energy influenced Springsteen's guitar style and stage presence.

3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.name: Pete Seeger
3eqjTLE0HfPfh78zjh6TqT.impact: Seeger's folk music and activism influenced Springsteen's music and his engagement with social issues.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Charlie Parker
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Charlie Parker was a pivotal figure in the development of bebop, and his innovative approach to improvisation and complex chord progressions greatly influenced Davis' early career.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Dizzy Gillespie
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Dizzy Gillespie's virtuosic trumpet playing and harmonic complexity had a significant impact on Davis, shaping his approach to the trumpet and jazz composition.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Billy Eckstine
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Billy Eckstine's band was a breeding ground for young talent, including Davis. The band's approach to bebop and swing influenced Davis' early understanding of jazz.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Elvin Jones
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Although primarily known for his work with John Coltrane, Jones' innovative drumming techniques and rhythmic complexity influenced Davis' approach to rhythm in jazz.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Ahmad Jamal
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Ahmad Jamal's use of space and his minimalist approach deeply influenced Davis' playing and his concept of modal jazz.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Gil Evans
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Gil Evans was a close collaborator with Davis on several important projects, including 'Birth of the Cool'. Evans' innovative arrangements and use of orchestration were key influences on Davis.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: John Lewis
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: John Lewis, pianist and musical director of the Modern Jazz Quartet, influenced Davis with his approach to composition and his blend of classical music with jazz, particularly in modal jazz.

0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.name: Thelonious Monk
0kbYTNQb4Pb1rPbbaF0pT4.impact: Monk's unconventional approach to piano playing, composition, and improvisation influenced Davis' exploration of dissonance and rhythm.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Charlie Parker
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Charlie Parker's virtuosic technique and harmonic innovations greatly influenced Coltrane's early development as a musician.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Johnny Hodges
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Hodges' smooth, lyrical style on the alto sax inspired Coltrane's approach to the instrument, emphasizing expressiveness and melody.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Dizzy Gillespie
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: As one of the pioneers of bebop, Gillespie's advancements in jazz harmony and rhythm had a significant influence on Coltrane's musical direction.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Thelonious Monk
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Monk's unconventional approach to composition and improvisation encouraged Coltrane to explore beyond traditional harmonic structures.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Duke Ellington
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Ellington's mastery of mood and his orchestral approach to jazz composition influenced Coltrane's sense of arrangement and thematic development.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Miles Davis
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Davis' innovative approach to jazz, including modal jazz, influenced Coltrane's exploration of modal improvisation and his development as a bandleader.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: Lester Young
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Young's relaxed, smooth phrasing and unique tonal quality influenced Coltrane's search for his own voice on the tenor sax.

2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.name: John Gilmore
2hGh5VOeeqimQFxqXvfCUf.impact: Gilmore's work with Sun Ra's Arkestra introduced Coltrane to avant-garde and space music elements, influencing his later experimental works.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Jimi Hendrix
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Inspired Julian Lage with his expressive guitar playing and innovation.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Pat Metheny
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Influenced Lage's approach to jazz guitar and improvisation.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Wes Montgomery
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Montgomery's smooth, melodic approach to jazz guitar left a significant mark on Lage's playing.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Bill Frisell
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Frisell's unique blending of jazz, folk, and Americana has greatly influenced Lage's own style.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: George Benson
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Benson's fluid playing and use of octaves have inspired aspects of Lage's guitar work.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Béla Bartók
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Bartók's compositions and his approach to blending folk music with classical elements have inspired Lage's own compositional style.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Johann Sebastian Bach
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Bach's complex harmonies and compositions have deeply influenced Lage's understanding and approach to music.

2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.name: Tal Farlow
2TSuAchdgVzsAa9wDK1IeT.impact: Farlow's virtuosic technique and innovative harmonic approach have been a significant influence on Lage's guitar style.
